intro: Erythranthe nasuta, commonly known as the slender flowering plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Erythranthe nasuta is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in mild, temperate climates.
